bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, June 27, 1901
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D AUG 3 '01 DEPT OF STATE
ACKNOWLEDGED AUG 19 1901 Bureau of Foreign Commerce.

div1.p: No. 74. Consular. Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, June 27, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State Washington.
Subject. A system of Telephones is now being constructed in the city of Monrovia.
No. 74. Consular. Consulate General of the United States Monrovia Liberia, June 27, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Seretary of State, Washington.

Sir: Referring to my No. 60, Consular, of February 6, 1901; I now have the honor to say that T. J. R. Faulkner Esq. is now canstructing a system of Telephones in the city of Monrovia; connecting many of the business houses and public buildings.
Contemplating a change of location I have not had a wire connected with this Legation. I have the honor to be your obedient servant; Owen L. W. Smith, C. G.
